alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 1:56PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by snowmelt and warmer temperatures is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Mono. * WHEN...Until noon PDT Monday. Flows will vary throughout the day with many creeks and streams seeing the highest flows at night. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over mountain roads near creeks and streams. Hazards for backcountry recreation activities through this weekend in Mono County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 135 PM PDT, Gauge reports of several small streams in Mono county indicated rises and increased flows due to snowmelt. Warmer temperatures through this weekend will produce further increases in flows. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Areas near eastern Sierra creeks and streams across Mono County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded mountain roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can flow over their banks as snowmelt increases. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks, which can become dangerous to cross due to fast and cold flows.
